**SAS N2 Building Automation System (BAS) Upgrade**
================<<<<<<<<
### Title (English): SAS N2 Building Automation System (BAS) Upgrade

### Title (French): SAS N2 Mise à niveau du contrôleur du système d’automatisation du bâtiment (SAB)

### Reference Number: PW-23-01021735
### Solicitation Number: 22-58116
### Posting Date: January 17, 2023

**Call for Tender**
-----------------

This is an advance contract award notice (ACAN) for a competitive bidding process. Suppliers interested in participating in this bid should submit a statement of capabilities by January 31, 2023 at 14:00 (Eastern Standard Time). If a suitable supplier does not submit a statement of capabilities, the contract may be awarded to a pre-selected supplier.

**Scope of Work**
-----------------

The National Research Council of Canada (NRC) seeks to upgrade the Building Automation System (BAS) at its Gymnasium Road Campus in Saskatoon. The existing system uses the proprietary "N2" communication language (protocol), which has reached the end of its life and has been phased out in favor of the open source "BACnet" MS/TP communication language (protocol).

The goal of this project is to ensure ongoing system compatibility and interoperability within the existing NRC infrastructure while removing potential service disruptions. The upgrades will involve replacing infrastructure and equipment still operating on the "N2" protocol with the "BACnet" protocol under the Metasys Building Automation System.

**Contractor Requirements**
---------------------------

Interested suppliers must meet the following criteria:

* Be able to provide products and services that meet the technical requirements outlined in the tender document
* Have a proven track record of successful system upgrades and replacements
* Demonstrate a thorough understanding of the Metasys Building Automation System and the BACnet protocol
* Provide a detailed cost estimate and project timeline

**Notice and Attachments**
-------------------------

The full notice and tender document can be found on the Canada Buys website: [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2023/01/17/3ba05dba21d30e760f00c616e614b969/22-58116_-_acan_sas_bas_upgrade_-_english.pdf](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2023/01/17/3ba05dba21d30e
